Sentencas: All porous solid oxide fuel cells adopt a porous electrolyte to resist coking caused by hydrocarbon fuels such as methane.
Titulo: The thermal effects of all porous solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: With O-2 molecules coming from the cathode, chemical oxidation reactions occur at the anode, competing with the electrochemical oxidations with O2- ions.
Titulo: The thermal effects of all porous solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: These reactions release a lot of heat, thus significantly affects the cell's power density and fuel efficiency.
Titulo: The thermal effects of all porous solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In this paper, we developed a 2D thermal-electrochemical model to study its thermal effects.
Titulo: The thermal effects of all porous solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: After model validation, parametric studies are conducted to investigate the impact of operating condition and cell structure.
Titulo: The thermal effects of all porous solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Cell performance, including power density, coking resistance, peak cell temperature, heat source composition, and energy efficiency is analysed.
Titulo: The thermal effects of all porous solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Notably, the detailed heat-releasing processes at different operating conditions are discussed.
Titulo: The thermal effects of all porous solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: A power density of 373 mW cm(-2) is obtained when a CH4 and O-2 concentration of 10% and an electrolyte thickness of 200 mu m are adopted.
Titulo: The thermal effects of all porous solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: This model can serve as a useful tool for the optimization of operating conditions and geometry design to improve the performance and coking resistance of solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: The thermal effects of all porous solid oxide fuel cells
